noun.name: bus
noun.discription: a large motor vehicle carrying passengers by road, typically one serving the public on a fixed route and for a fare

object1.name: train
object1.discription: in parallel with 'bus', is a series of connected vehicles that run along a track to transport passengers or goods

object2.name: tram
object2.discription: in parallel with 'bus', is a vehicle that runs on rails in the road, carrying passengers on a fixed route

object3.name: subway
object3.discription: in parallel with 'bus', is an underground railway system used for urban transportation

object4.name: ferry
object4.discription: in parallel with 'bus', is a boat or ship for conveying passengers and vehicles across a body of water

object5.name: bicycle
object5.discription: in parallel with 'bus', is a two-wheeled vehicle that is pedaled by the rider

object6.name: motorcycle
object6.discription: in parallel with 'bus', is a two-wheeled motor vehicle

object7.name: taxi
object7.discription: in parallel with 'bus', is a private hire vehicle authorized to transport passengers in return for payment of a fare

object8.name: airplane
object8.discription: in parallel with 'bus', is a powered flying vehicle with fixed wings and a weight greater than that of the air it displaces
